definition: towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
a woman is born to leave her family (idiom)/a woman's heart is with her husband

sentences.english: There's something about being extroverted that seems to protect people.
sentences.chinese: 性格外向的人有某种东西似乎在保护他们。

sentences.english: Let’s take the example of an introvert and an extrovert.
sentences.chinese: 我们用性格内向和外向的人举个例子。

sentences.english: The circumstances of your life suggest extroversion.
sentences.chinese: 你的生活环境应当外向些。

sentences.english: The Arab people are known for their extroverted natures, for their love of peace.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯人民以性格外向和热爱和平著称。

sentences.english: The beggar sat outside the building asking passersby for money.
sentences.chinese: 那个乞丐坐在大楼外向路人讨钱。

sentences.english: My sister is an out-going person.
sentences.chinese: 我的姐姐是个外向的人。

sentences.english: Extroverts that share one of your core passions are also a good match.
sentences.chinese: 那些和你有着共同爱好的外向的人也是很好的选择。

sentences.english: The system mode of the coaches role to athletes during the process of trainning;
sentences.chinese: 教练站在场外向他的运动员吆喝。

sentences.english: The convenient land and water transport is conducive to the development of export-oriented economy.
sentences.chinese: 水陆交通便利，有利于外向型经济的发展。

sentences.english: This usage makes the extrovert and the introvert seem to stand for opposed personality types.
sentences.chinese: 你觉得你的个性是倾于外向，还是内向？

sentences.english: I'm an out-going girl, people round me like me very much.
sentences.chinese: 我是个外向的女孩，身边的人都很喜欢我。

sentences.english: Iris is an energetic and outgoing student.
sentences.chinese: 颖贤是一个有干劲和外向的学生。

sentences.english: Thus, while the U. S. might value extraverts, other cultures value introverted personality.
sentences.chinese: 因此，美国较看重外向者，而其他文化则重视内向的。

sentences.english: Introverts tend to be much more even-keeled and level than extroverts.
sentences.chinese: 相比外向的人而言，内向的人更容易平静下来。

sentences.english: Still can adjust by scaleboard of the elapse inside extroversion clearance, control gives makings size.
sentences.chinese: 还可以由外向内推移衬板调节间隙，控制出料粒度。

sentences.english: A left brainer is an extrovert, particularly good at schmoozing with people.
sentences.chinese: 左脑思考者是个外向，特别善于与人交谈的家伙。

definition: spacious and well-lit/open and clear/(of character) optimistic/cheerful/carefree
to fit in/to get on well with others/sociable/to form a mutually supportive group
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
to get hyped up in front of an audience/(of children) to play up in front of guests
(coll.) outwardly cold or retiring but deep and passionate inside
